result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jake Matthew Kurer

defendant.name: Kurer, Jake Matthew
defendant.address: S65 W18516 Silver Drive, Muskego, WI 53150

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jake Matthew Kurer in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jake Matthew Kurer.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No driving without a valid license. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.

Defendant Jake Matthew Kurer in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appearing for Attorney Haley Wentz in court for Jake Matthew Kurer.  Student Intern Abagail Doweiko under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for arraignment hearing in Branch 40.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/16/22 @ 1:30p
